column4: So will anyone help me install java? I already have the stupid file, but its not installing
it would probably help if you explained what "not installing" means
it says "the folder does not exist"?
how else do you expect anyone to tell you what is wrong?
and what did you type to get it to output that?
maybe you should make that directory first?
maybe you should be doing what the instructions say as root?
well it didn't say, "sorry, I am not allowing you to change files in /usr/local", so what did it actually say
the part about you not bothing to give actual, real, error messages and instead your flawed interpretations of them
weren't you just talking about some instructions?
why can't you make new folders?
YOU are the one sitting in front of YOUR computer
ffs, it's the same command as before
